title: Sciatica
description: Pain in the sciatic nerve from back down the leg caused by compressed or irritated nerves, often due to herniated discs or spinal stenosis.

title: Lower Crossed Syndrome
description: Characterized by overactivation of abdominal muscles and underactivation of gluteus maximus, leading to hip flexion and backward pelvic tilt. It has two subtypes: A (anterior pelvic crossed syndrome) and B (posterior pelvic crossed syndrome).

title: Deep Vein Thrombosis
description: A blood clot that commonly occurs in the legs, potentially fatal. Often caused by a sedentary lifestyle, injury, or high blood pressure.

title: Lumbar Spinal Stenosis
description: Narrowing of the spinal canal causing nerve compression, leading to pain and discomfort.

title: Cervical Spinal Stenosis
description: Narrowing of the cervical spinal canal causing nerve compression, leading to pain and discomfort.

title: Hyperlordosis
description: Excessive curvature of the spine leading to discomfort and poor posture, also known as hollowback or swayback.

title: Eye Strain (Computer Vision Syndrome)
description: Strain on eye muscles caused by prolonged screen time without breaks.

title: Tension Headaches
symptoms: dull, aching pain around forehead or back of head
description: Muscle tension in the neck and shoulders from poor posture, eye strain, or stress.

title: Cervical Strain (Neck Pain)
symptoms: pain and stiffness in the neck
radiating pain to upper back and shoulders
description: Strain on the cervical spine from improper posture.

title: Temporomandibular Joint Disorder (TMJ)
description: Jaw clenching or grinding, often linked to stress or intense focus.
treatment: mouth guards if clenching occurs at night

title: Upper Crossed Syndrome
description: Tightening of chest and neck muscles with weakening of upper back muscles due to prolonged slouching.
treatment: strengthening exercises for back and shoulders

title: Shoulder Impingement Syndrome
description: Irritation of shoulder tendons from overuse, particularly when raising arms frequently.
treatment: regular breaks to relax shoulder muscles

title: Tension Myalgia (Muscle Strain)
symptoms: aching muscles in neck, upper back, and shoulders
description: Chronic stress or poor posture leading to muscle overuse.

title: Tech Neck
description: Unnatural forward head position from looking down at screens, putting pressure on the cervical spine.

title: Shoulder Overuse Tendinopathy
description: Pain in the outer part of the upper arm, worsens when raising hands or reaching.

title: Elbow Overuse Tendinopathy
description: Develops from repetitive use of forearm extensors, more common in individuals aged 30-60 and gamers.

title: Cubital Tunnel Syndrome
description: Neuropathy of the ulnar nerve due to inflammation from repetitive movements.

title: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
description: Inflammation in the wrist caused by poor workstation ergonomics.

title: Gamer Thumb
description: Inflammation and irritation of tendons around the thumb due to repetitive stress.
